description: Stochastic Castro policy for Bank B, symmetric to Bank A. Initial collateral is reduced to 20% of max capacity to lower collateral costs, while preserving a strict urgency rule (ticks_to_deadline <= 2) and a buffered liquidity check for non-urgent payments to maintain robust 100% settlement across stochastic seeds.

strategic_collateral_tree.description: At the start of the day, decide initial liquidity by posting 20% of max collateral capacity. This reduction cuts collateral cost while relying on conservative payment timing and the urgency rule for robust settlement.

on_true.description: Post initial_liquidity_fraction of max collateral capacity at tick 0.

on_false.description: No further collateral adjustments during the day; intraday liquidity is managed through the payment timing and urgency rules.

payment_tree.description: Determine whether the payment is urgent based on ticks_to_deadline. Urgent payments are always released, independent of current liquidity, to eliminate any chance of EOD penalties.

on_true.description: Payment is urgent (ticks_to_deadline <= urgency_threshold). Release it immediately to guarantee settlement before the deadline and avoid EOD penalties.

on_false.description: For non-urgent payments, release only if effective liquidity comfortably covers the payment with a buffer, to limit later-day liquidity stress given the lower initial collateral.

on_true.description: Effective liquidity is at least remaining_amount * liquidity_buffer_factor, so release the payment without materially increasing liquidity risk.

on_false.description: Buffered liquidity is insufficient and the payment is not yet urgent. Hold it to promote intraday netting and keep liquidity demands contained; it will be released automatically once it becomes urgent.
